description: Enterprise techniques used by Flame, ATT&CK software S0143 v1.1
name: Flame (S0143)

techniques.comment: Flame can record audio using any existing hardware recording devices.[1][2]
Flame can use Windows Authentication Packages for persistence.[4]
Flame can create backdoor accounts with login "HelpAssistant" on domain connected systems if appropriate rights are available.[1][2]

Flame has a module named BeetleJuice that contains Bluetooth functionality that may be used in different ways, including transmitting encoded information from the infected system over the Bluetooth protocol, acting as a Bluetooth beacon, and identifying other Bluetooth devices in the vicinity.[3]
Flame can use MS10-061 to exploit a print spooler vulnerability in a remote system with a shared printer in order to move laterally.[1][2]
Flame contains modules to infect USB sticks and spread laterally to other Windows systems the stick is plugged into using Autorun functionality.[1]
Flame can take regular screenshots when certain applications are open that are sent to the command and control server.[1]
Rundll32.exe is used as a way of executing Flame at the command-line.[4]
Flame identifies security software such as antivirus through the Security module.[1][2]
